title: Simple circuits - battery bulb switches resistor

content.question: The figure shows a circuit that consisting of a battery, two switches, <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, a lightbulb, and a resistor. For which of the following switch positions will the bulb be lit?

choices.label: <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> open and <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> closed

<math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> closed and <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> open

content.answer: <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> closed and <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> open

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
